channel.title: Attempting to wire a bunch of buttons
channel.description: I just found out about keyboard matrices, which are definitely better than using an input for each switch, but I'm wondering how I should wire it, or if it's even possible. Specifically, I don't know which inputs and outputs to use. I get the idea of the rows and columns though.

item.title: Attempting to wire a bunch of buttons
item.dc:creator: @SmashedTransistors
item.description:
@SmashedTransistors wrote:

If you plan to press multiple keys at once (which is often the case for a musical instrument) do not forget deghosting diodes.
http://weirdscience.us/index.php/2017/03/01/ghosting-and-masking/

All the GPIOs on the Axoloti can be used as inputs or as outputs.

Don't forget that you will have to design a scanning code/object for your keyboard.
